column1: Checks require a stamp of 4 cents
column2: also promissory notes. The excess-profit rate remains at 80 per cent. The tax on spirits is raised to $7.50 a gallon; on beer to $12.50 a barrel; on tobacco to $2.04 a pound
column3: the effect of which will increase the price 4 cents an ounce
column6: will be 7 cents for ten. The tax on matches is increased so that they will be sold at 2 cents a box instead of 1 and a half cents. An additional duty of $3 a hundredweight is levied on sugar
column7: so that sugar heretofore selling at 11and a half cents a pound will now have to be sold at 14 cents a pound.A tax of 16 and two thirds per cent
column8: is levied on the sale of luxuries
column10: and of articles above a certain price when they become articles of luxury; also on hotel and restaurant bills. This tax will be collected by means of stamps.
